{
    "number": 127930,
    "data": "3,43,109,163,307,439,541,619,937",
    "name": "Terms of A127928 that are prime in A006577.",
    "comment": [
        "Through a(9) the terms have the following number of 3x+1 problem steps: 7, 29, 113, 23, 37, 53, 43, 131, 173."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Douglas J. Shaw, <a href=\"http://www.fq.math.ca/Papers1/44-3/quartshaw03_2006.pdf\">The Pure Numbers Generated by the Collatz Sequence</a>, The Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 44, Number 3, August 2006, pp. 194-201."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "A127928 = numbers that are both pure hailstone (Collatz) and prime. A127930 = the subset having prime steps to reach 1; given the Collatz rule C(n) = {3n+1, n odd; n/2 if n is even}."
    ],
    "example": [
        "3 is in the set A127930 since the iterative trajectory of 3 has 7 steps: (10, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1) and 7 is prime."
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A006577, A066903, A127928, A127928, A061641, A127633."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,more",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Gary W. Adamson_, Feb 07 2007",
    "references": 3,
    "revision": 6,
    "time": "2016-03-09T03:22:34-05:00",
    "created": "2007-05-11T03:00:00-04:00"
}
